Meet the Team

Ekawahyu Susilo

Entrepreneurial Lead

Given more than 8 years of experiences in electronics miniaturization, Eka’s career has been focused on starting a business of low cost, deeply embedded microelectronic manufacturing. He can bring miniaturization technology into a whole new level of modular electronics. Combined this with his passion in open source software movement, he believes that everyone deserves to get their hands on open source miniature electronics. He is very committed to make miniature electronics affordable, scalable, reliable, and most importantly, monetizable!

Pietro Valdastri

Principal Investigator

Pietro strongly believes that research in engineering must reach the end user to have an impact on society. He also has first-hand experience in start-up business creation. In 2009, he launched Winmedical srl, a med-tech company proposing a patented wearable modular system for continuous monitoring of physiological parameters. The company has 25 employees and is negotiating a potential acquisition with one of the worldwide leaders in medical device manufacturing.

Chris Harris

Business Mentor

Chris brings a proven track record of exploiting novel technologies for commercial partnership, joint-venture, and technology and product development. His expertise includes evaluating a technology’s technical strength, building key strategies for advancing product development with commercial partners, and negotiating tactical licensing agreements with public research institutions, private companies, and ‘Fortune 5’ corporations. He is also experienced at working with university start-ups to perform venture assessments and to develop a viable business model.
